title: (x) Sunset Magazine logo - custom designed (similar to Mousse Script), Auto {Yves (Stephen)}
content:
Anyone know the font from Sunset Magazine (attached ant at [http://www.sunset.com/sunset/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140711235041/http:/www.sunset.com/sunset/ "http://www.sunset.com/sunset/"))? It may be a custom logotype. Cheers,

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sunset\_logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140711235041/http:/typophile.com/files/sunset_logo.jpg) | 8.58 KB |
author: nofi

comments.content: Could be custom designed indeed. The sans is Auto by [Underware](http://web.archive.org/web/20140711235041/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Underware).
You might like [Mousse Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20140711235041/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000162) as an alternative.

I realize this response is a bit belated, but I just happened across the posting. I was the Creative Director at Sunset who, along with Michael Grossman, oversaw this logo redesign. The project was indeed a custom-lettering job, ably rendered by Mr. [Leslie Cabarga](http://web.archive.org/web/20140711235041/http:/www.lesliecabarga.com/).
